Fields.DialogueText: That's the way, lads! For God and our country!
Nelson, what are you shooting at? Have you spotted Morganas?
Everything is shipshape, Captain! Nothing to report.
Then why are your guns firing?
Ah, well, I have to make sure they're in tip top shape, don't I?

Fields.MenuText: Very well, carry on then. But inform me next time.
We are trying not to attract attention out here, Nelson.
I do love seeing the big guns fire, give the fleet a show, eh?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, sir. My apologies for the disruption, but I assure you it's worth it.
Ah, of course, sir. I'll have the men stand down.
There's nothing like having all eyes on me, Captain.
Belay that, Nelson - we've got approaching Morganas. It looks like you attracted some attention.
It's damn good of them to come when they're called, all told. We'll have to reward them by making this quick.
@BATTLE
Battlestations, lads! We've got enemies incoming!
@BATTLE
Everything squared away properly after that last battle, Nelson?
Sound as a pound, Captain! We were having a tad bit of trouble with Minnie, but I think she was just jealous of the attention Mickey was receiving.
I'm sorry, what?
Ah. I meant one of the guns had a bit of a sighting issue, but only because it was the last one we were ranging when the attack came.

Fields.MenuText: You named your guns?
You named your guns after cartoon characters?
You named your guns after American children's cartoon characters?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, sir! How would they know how much I loved them if I didn't give them names?
Are you going to propose a better naming scheme, hmm?
Walt Disney is a visionary. His cartoons are a masterpiece of cinema!
Very well, carry on then, I suppose.
Of course, sir. And we'll have Minnie straightened out in two ticks.
Nelson, where are you? We're preparing an attack, and I'd like your insight.
Up here, Captain - be down shortly.
There you are. What's that- were you writing a letter?
Spot on, Captain. I was just keeping my sister Rodney abreast of our travels, and of the things we've seen.
I see.

Fields.MenuText: Go ahead and finish your letter, the war can wait a few minutes.
Rodney can wait until after we're through planning, it should not take long.
We have a war to win here, Nelson, and I need you focused on it.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain. It will just take a moment.
Of course, Captain. Rodney would understand.
My apologies, Captain. I assure you you won't catch me writing letters while on duty again.
Very well, then.
*ALARM*
That's the alarm! I suppose we will all have to wait, hmm?
Yes, yes - now get to your station. We have a battle to fight.
I'm on my way!
@BATTLE
That took longer than I was anticipating, but I feel it was a productive strategy meeting.
I'm always thrilled to share my expertise with the fleet, for the good of the cause.

Fields.MenuText: Not that anyone else could get a word in edgewise.
And I think we're all happy to have such a resolute voice at the table.
And what part of your illustrious history did you retrieve those tactics from, then?

Fields.DialogueText: Please, I only shouted down those voices not intending on being disruptive. The lack of focus back there was hardly my fault.
Indeed, I am glad I had the opportunity to steer the discussion towards proper tactics.
Please, I am intimately familiar with the works of the greatest Admiral in all of naval history. Did you think my namesake was merely a coincidence?
I suppose that's fair. Still, your tactics are dynamic, and I think they give us a good chance of victory.
I can guarantee splitting the enemy fleet is the right choice. I know how to gamble on short odds.
That may not be as reassuring a statement as you meant it to be, Nelson.
Ah, but it's me saying it, Captain. And besides, I'm sure you'll get the opportunity to test my plans in short order.
*ALARM*
There's the alarm, I suppose you're right.
The BF are always so obliging, aren't they, Captain?
@BATTLE
Battlestations, lads! We've got enemies incoming!
@BATTLE
Nelson, why are your guns still firing? Is something wrong?
No, Captain! No problems here, thank you for asking.
Okay. So, I repeat the question - why are your guns still firing?
What, exactly, are you shooting at?
... Why, Captain, that's just a bit of high spirits amongst the crew.
High spirits? We talked about this, Nelson.
If you must know, I lost a bet with the quartermaster.
Since I have no real money of my own, he generously allowed me to exchange his marker for a turn firing the main guns.

Fields.MenuText: I can't believe you're gambling at a time like this. You need to take your duties more seriously.
Remember what happened last time you fired the guns without cause? You're going to attract another battle, and we just finished fighting.
Save me a seat at the table next time there's a game, will you?

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, I would never let my leisure time distract me from my duty to my fleet and my country!
We've driven off every Morgana in the region. I'm sure we're safe for the moment.
Oh no, what did I get myself into now?
Still, at the very least, I would rather we not waste ammunition, if at all possible. Please, limit unnecessary use of the guns.
All right, all right.
Captain, I have a message for the fleet.
Of course, Nelson. Something important, I trust?
Of the utmost, my Captain. I'm going to hold a screening in my gunroom. Mess dress expected, of course.

Fields.MenuText: Is this really worth broadcasting to the fleet?
Such frivolities have no place in a time of war.
That sounds like a pleasant diversion from this terrible war.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Captain! We are all of one purpose against these vile Morganas, so we must have unity!
Have a care, Captain! Such frivolities, as you put it, are what make us civilized. Next you'll be demanding we cease taking tea.
My thoughts exactly, Captain. I'll be sure to save a seat for you.
Very well, you've convinced me, make the announcement.
*ALARM*
Captain! Morganas sighted off the starboard side!
Well, it seems the radio is in use at the moment. I suppose I'll wait to make my announcement until later.
That sounds wise.
@BATTLE
Nelson, what are you doing in the wardroom? We need you down on the deck, supervising the gun crews.
Oh no, I'm sure the lads are fine. I have every faith in them.
I'm shocked! I never thought I'd see the day you didn't take personal responsibility for your guns.
It's not so strange, really. The crews are very well trained, and I can keep an eye on them from up here after all.
Pie's ready! Be right there with your slice, Lady Nelson!

Fields.MenuText: Neglecting your duties for pie, Nelson?
Is this why you scheduled deck cleaning and holed up in the wardroom?
Can I have a slice of that? It smells delicious.

Fields.DialogueText: I told you, I can assist easily enough from here. It just so happens that here is also where cherry pies occasionally come out of the oven.
I haven't holed up anywhere! And it is simply coincidence that maintenance was scheduled at the same time the cook was baking fresh cherry pie.
Absolutely, but only after I get mine. This cherry pie is to die for.
Here you go, Lady Nelson, and another slice for the Captain. Anything else I can...
*ALARM*
Is that the alarm?
Looks like pie will have to wait.
Noooooo! *mulph* Keep the rest of it warm for me. I'll be back after I've sent these monsters to hell!
@BATTLE
I have to say, Nelson, your strategies are proving to be very effective.
Of course, Captain. They won the day at the battle of Trafalgar, and divide and conquer has been military dogma for millennia.
Fair enough. I've communicated it to the other fleets, and they're all reporting an increase in success against the Morganas.
They're no different than any other enemies, really. If you push them hard enough, they'll topple.

Fields.MenuText: Well, you're tactics are certainly being validated.
I like it. We've been on the defensive too long.
I've heard the same thing about you, you know.

Fields.DialogueText: Hah, they were validated a hundred years ago. This is simply practice.
I knew you were stand-up sort, Captain! Not content to take things the way they are.
Well, one should not listen to porkies spread by the less than proper members of our fleet. I thought better of you, Captain.
Hold that thought. It sounds like we have another opportunity to test your tactics.
We do not test them, Captain. We are perfecting them.
@BATTLE
All set for your movie night?
Steady on! We still need to make sure of the guest list and prepare victuals suitable for the theme. I wonder where we can get apples this time of year.
Apples? What do you need with apples?
For the crew! I thought it would be brilliant if we could get them each an apple.
Especially seeing as we're going to have to do a dual screening in the wardroom and the gunroom. It was hard enough getting a second print.
I... need you to explain the apple business, and why this idea has you so enthralled.
For Snow White! I don't want to bodge this one, men from all over the fleet will be here.

Fields.MenuText: You really like Disney's work, don't you?
That's the movie you picked? I was hoping for something a little more exciting.
An excellent choice, that will really liven up the spirits of the men.

Fields.DialogueText: The man is a visionary, and his work is champion. You better not bunk off on me for this one.
That's a load of dog's bollocks, and I won't hear owt against Snow White.
Cor! That's the ticket, Captain. We'll have everyone singing in tune soon enough.
Now, I just need to see the quartermaster about laying hands on a few bushels of apples.
*ALARM*
That's the alarm, so it will have to wait.
@BATTLE
There you are!
Where have you been this time, Nelson? You missed a strategy meeting.
Chapel, of course. It was time for my morning prayer.

Fields.MenuText: Prayer? How does that work?
I didn't know you were religious.
We don't have time for that, there's a war on.

Fields.DialogueText: The same as it does for anyone else, I reckon. I simply kneel and beg God for a swift end to this war.
Of course! How could anyone look at the miracles in this world and not believe?
How do you reckon we'll win this war without God on our side, hmm?
Look, we have more pressing issues. The Morganas are starting–
To adapt to our tactics, I know. Why do you think I went looking for divine inspiration? Revolutionary thinking is only revolutionary for so long.
*ALARM*
Well, that's the alarm. What do you propose we do instead?
Let me act with aggro this battle, and we'll see if we can't come up with new plans to reduce these pillocks to a load of old boffins.
@BATTLE
Battlestations, lads! We've got enemies incoming!
@BATTLE
Well, that was rough for everyone. Did you come up with any new ideas?
No, Captain, I haven't. They're adapting faster than I expected, and I don't know how to counter it.
I'm sure you'll think of something. And remember, we're all in this together.
Yes, but it's my tactics they're countering, and my tactics that've gone belly up.
I know you have it in you to help us through this.

Fields.MenuText: Why don't you take some time to focus on the movie showing? Perhaps your favorite film will provide some inspiration.
Maybe if you spend some more time in prayer, the idea will come to you.
Just keep throwing yourself into the fight. The more time you spend up close and personal with the enemy, the more you'll learn.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain. I know I'm winging a bit. Perhaps aiming my attention at something else for a while will open my mind to new ideas.
Thank you, Captain. I know I'm winging a bit. I'm sure the Lord will provide if I ask and wait for His instruction.
Thank you, Captain. I know I'm winging a bit. That's the ticket! If I remain relentless, I'll see what makes the blaggards tick right enough!
I'm glad I could help. I'm sure you'll figure it out, Nelson.
Thank you, Captain.
How's the planning coming along for the film showing, Nelson?
Oh, good. Only... I've hit a bit of a snag, if I'm honest.
What kind of snag? Anything I can help with?
Oh, no - nothing to trouble yourself over. I just had a bit of a flutter and now the apples are a bit out of reach.
"A bit of a flutter?"
Oh, I was just having a hand of cards with the quartermaster, and he may now have the apples, along with a few bits and bobs.
I can't believe you were gambling again – and with your precious apples, no less.

Fields.MenuText: Let me sit in on the next game, and I'll get your apples back.
I'll have a word with the quartermaster about this. You need to be more responsible about this sort of thing.
How do you expect to help the fleet if you can't even keep a hold of your own supplies? I'll deal with this.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the spirit Captain! We'll show him wot's wot!
My apologies, Captain. It seemed like such a sure thing. I'll be more careful in the future.
I'm sorry, it was just a bit of a lark, but it got out of hand.
*ALARM*
Hear that? We'll have to take care of this later. Morganas are incoming.
@BATTLE
How are you doing, Nelson? Any tactical insights yet?
Not yet, Captain. But God and my country are with me, so I'm keeping my chin up.
That's good, at least. I appreciate knowing you are keeping in good spirits.
Always, Captain. It's not always easy, though – I can't turn a blind eye to the trouble we're all having.
You know, Nelson...?
What, Captain?
I have a question I've been meaning to ask you.
Ask it, then! I am always happy to do my part to assist the fleet!
This is more of a personal question.

Fields.MenuText: How does a Belle come to be a Christian?
Don't you think it's a little odd for a Belle to believe in God?
Do you really think you should be spending time in prayer when there are so many pressing things to do?

Fields.DialogueText: How does one become anything? It's what I've always been. My faith brings me hope in the midst of this dark war.
Not odder than for a human being. It is not as though you have any more assurances than I do.
I think that as long as I continue to perform my duties, I can spend my leisure time however I please.
I can accept that. Now if you don't mind, we're heading towards another Morgana sighting. Get ready for a fight.
@BATTLE
Captain, there you are! I have something I'd like to discuss with you, if you have a moment.
Oh? What can I do for you this time, Nelson?
Please, call me Nellie, Captain. And I need to ask a favor of you.
All right... Nellie. Is this about the new strategy?
Not exactly, but it's not too far off. Anyroad, I need you to call bagsies on a couple of good seats when the showing starts.

Fields.MenuText: That's it? You need me to make sure you have a good seat for the film showing?
Of course, Lady Nellie. I'll make sure you have the best seat in the house.
It's a deal, but only if you make sure I get first pick of the refreshments.

Fields.DialogueText: Hey, this is jolly important to me, and I want to make sure it goes off without a hitch. And who better to ask?
Oh, you are a charmer, Captain. I promise to make it worth your effort. I hope you like pan haggerty as much as I do!
That's a swizz and no mistake Captain, but I'll take it! Just make sure I get the best seat.
It's a deal, then. I will be waiting for you in the wardroom when the film starts.
Brilliant, Captain. Glad that's all tickety-boo now! I wish I could sort everything so easily.
*ALARM*
There's the alarm - let's see how well you sort this.
@BATTLE
There you are, Nellie. Writing another letter?
I didn't think anyone would object if I used my personal time to pen a letter to Rodney.
Not at all. I did mean to ask, though, why you were writing her a letter when you could simply radio her next time you're nearby.
Well the radio is just so impersonal, Captain. And who knows who could be listening?
I suppose that makes sense. An odd pastime, but not the oddest.
Hah, you've twigged it now. And, of course, that means it's there in case...

Fields.MenuText: There in case of what? I never figured you for a cryptic, Nellie.
Go on, you can't stop in the middle of a sentence like that.
Would you just tell me already? I don't have time to sit here and guess.

Fields.DialogueText: There in case I buy the farm. I don't want to leave anything unsaid between Rodney and myself.
I can do whatever I want. But the letters are there for Rodney if something happens to me.
Don't get miffed about my post habits. I'm just making sure Rodney is up to date and all, just in case one of our battles goes south.
That's reasonable and pragmatic.
*ALARM*
And there's the alarm.
I know, Captain. It is a bit morbid though, isn't it. Still, I'm hoping it's unnecessary all the same.
@BATTLE
Wotcher, Captain? Looking for that leftover pie the cook stashed in the galley?
Heh, you caught me, Nellie. And it looks like I caught you.
It's my personal time, I can have a brown ale or two if I like.

Fields.MenuText: By all means, far be it from me to regulate how you spend your off time.
Only if you share one with me. I never turn down a chance for an ale.
Hah, I always figured you for a rum lady, or maybe a brandy aficionado.

Fields.DialogueText: Cheers, Captain! Glad to know I don't need your permission to get chuffed.
As long as you don't let things get jammy while you're throwing them back with me.
Have a care, Captain. I never touch those. No, no, a good brown ale and a pan haggerty, that's the ticket.
Anyroad, Captain, what did you come to find me for? I know it wasn't just that you know I have a nose for vittles.
True enough. I came to see how the preparations for the film showing were coming along.
Champion, Captain! It's all coming together. The quartermaster made a complete volt-face and came up with a few crates of apples.
You're welcome for that. He's a man who needs to work on his tells a bit more if he wants to keep playing poker without losing his shirt.
I had a feeling that was your doing, Captain.
*ALARM*
Oh, there's the alarm. Why don't I show my appreciation on the battlefield?
@BATTLE
Are you all right, Nellie? You've looked pensive since that last skirmish with the Morganas.
I can't pin it, Captain. The BF are getting canny, and I just know they're getting wise to our tactics. I've tried to change it up a little...
But if they're still play acting like they're falling for our tricks, then they have to be up to something.
You're right, I'll inform the fleet to be on their guard. We've had some tough fights, but they should have adapted by now.

Fields.MenuText: What do you propose we do to prepare for the inevitable?
You had better come up with those new tactics, and soon.
I'm not worried. When the other foot falls, we'll just have to steam out of the way.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure, Captain. But I think we should start preparing for anything.
That's a lot of pressure, Captain, but that's how I work best. You won't be disappointed.
I wish I was much of an optimist as you, Captain. Or as much of a bloody berk.
That's the spirit, Nellie. Or, rather, you're the spirit.
You're a blooming git, Captain, and this whole mess is starting to smell quite off to me.
Me too. But we don't have many other choices, do we?
By God, we will do our duty. We have the backbone, we just have to stick with it.
*ALARM*
And there's the alarm, right on cue.
@BATTLE
Captain, I need your help figuring out how to schedule the showing! The fleet's all higglety pigglety.
All right, but how can I help with that? I can't exactly order everyone to converge for a film night.
I'm sure you could - but, rather, I'd like to have a look at the tactical plans. I can probably guess where we're more likely to see the BF pop up.
That way, I can plan the showing for one of the safer stretches.
That's a smart plan. I'll get you those maps right away.

Fields.MenuText: Why haven't you been putting this talent to use for the fleet this whole time?
I'm happy to know we'll get to see the film uninterrupted. It seems like it's very important to you.
This is a nice thing you're doing for the crew, Nellie. I'm sure they'll all appreciate it.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, yes, well... I'll do so right away, Captain. I've been a little carried away lately, I suppose.
More than you know, Captain, and I think it will be an inspiration to all of the lads and lasses in the fleet.
Things always run easy peasy when you've got a happy crew aboard.
Carry on then, Nellie. I have every faith in you and this endeavor of yours.
Ah, Captain, you know how to make a Lady feel special. Now, I sense there's a Morgana around here, so let's go give her a drubbing.
@BATTLE
Nellie! You're certainly looking pretty happy this morning. I take it things are looking up?
Spot on, Captain. I have an idea brewing, of how we might deal with the BF deciphering our tactics.
It can't come soon enough. We're taking a pounding out there.
I think I'm on the cusp of cracking this idea open, I just need a little more time, I think.

Fields.MenuText: That's good, but we don't really have time in abundance.
You had better, I'm not sure how much longer we can keep this up.
We'll buy you as much time as you need. I believe you can help us turn this war around.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, Captain, I know. This whole war's a pig's ear and no mistake. But we'll have it soon.
Don't go putting this all on me, Captain. Sure, I'm the best Lady for the job, but we have plenty of other minds mucking about.
Thanks, Captain. That's encouraging to hear.
I know, Nellie. We just have to hold it together long enough to make a difference.
We can do it, Captain. My cannons never tire, and if nothing else, we'll pound those poxy trollops to scrap and boffins.
Darn right, and it looks like you're going to get another chance right now. I see shapes on the horizon.
@BATTLE
For God and country! Show some backbone, lads - the enemy's upon us!
@BATTLE
How did we... oh, no. Captain, look at the fleet. I didn't realize how much damage we took!
The ships are still afloat. What's the issue?
Look at the crew! The Morganas weren't trying to sink us, they were trying to wound us. We need our medics!
The decks... there's blood everywhere. I was caught up in the battle, I didn't see their goal.
Captain, this whole bloody dog's breakfast is my fault! They were watching my tactics, they knew what we'd do!
Nellie, you can't blame yourself for what happened here today. This is war.

Fields.MenuText: You did all you could for these men, and I know you'll do everything you can to make sure this doesn't happen again.
We followed your tactics because it was the best plan we had. We just need a new plan. We can't fall for the same trick twice.
Honor their sacrifice, and fight twice as hard next time. We'll make sure these men didn't die in vain.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain. I'll do my best to be worthy of the trust they place in me, and my hull. Next time, we'll destroy the BF before they can fire a shot.
I know, Captain. Maybe we should go back to the old tactics and just give them a stand up fight next time. At least it will save us this.
My cannons will sing for those poor souls lost today, and we'll throw the BF in the bing when we're done!
That's what I wanted to hear, Nellie. We can't let the darkness of war consume us, not when we have so much we need to fight for.
I'm glad to see I'm rubbing off on you, Captain. Now, let's make sure the wounded are seen to.
How are you holding together, Nellie? How is the crew?
Holding together, Captain. We're keeping our chins up and battening down the hatches for the coming storm.
That's the most I can ask for. I'm glad to see you're not letting our losses stop you from going forward.
Pressing forward is what I do, Captain! You've seen my gun mountings, you total wally. I'm not very well circling an issue.
Good point. How does the return to our old tactics sit with you? I know we had some success with yours.
It's fine. It's not perfect, but it spares us another bloodbath. Still, I just know my idea will come together soon, and I'll have a corker of a surprise for those scrubbers.

Fields.MenuText: I trust you have something good in the works. I can't wait to turn the tables on those monsters.
It can't come soon enough, I prefered the dynamism of your tactics to these line battles.
Just keep doing whatever keeps you occupied. I need you in top shape for the battles to come.

Fields.DialogueText: I promise you, it'll be brilliant, Captain. We'll get even with those hags and maybe turn the tables in the war.
Myself as well, Captain, but we cannot risk the BF luring us into another trap.
I'm still the sharpest tactical mind we have.
Very well. By the way, we are heading towards another reported Morgana sighting, so ready your men for battle.
They're eager for it now, Captain. They have a score to settle.
@BATTLE
Are you ready for the film, Captain? I think I did a good job of turning the wardroom and gunroom into a real cinema.
You did an excellent job, and it looks like word got around pretty well about this.
Hah, yeah, the queue is almost wrapped around the bridge! I'm excited, everyone is going to love this film.
I've been talking to the crew, and they're all excited for a little respite.
You'll still be saving me a seat, yes?
Absolutely, Nellie. I wouldn't want you to miss the production, especially after you put so much effort into it.

Fields.MenuText: How does it feel, watching all your hard work come to fruition?
I'm still skeptical this will live up to all the expectations you've set for us.
I'm just glad we have a break from the war for a little while.

Fields.DialogueText: Cor, I'm proper chuffed, I can't believe it's finally happening!
I gave it the full monty, I can promise it'll be a brilliant experience for everyone.
That's true, indeed. These battles have me knackered, especially now that we're back to slugging it out.
*ALARM*
Oh, for the love of... I'll sink the whole slag heap if they keep this up.
It's okay, Nellie, we'll push them back and then come and watch the film, no interruptions. But it's time to fight before we play.
@BATTLE
Show some backbone, crew! Send those blaggards packing! For God and our country! We have a film night to get to.
That was an excellent film, I must say. And the way the crew cheered, I could tell they really appreciated all of the effort you put into this.
Thank you, Captain. I am really happy that I was able to share something so special to me with the fleet.
I'm just glad I was able to save you a seat, Nellie. It was pretty packed in there. Thanks for the food and drink.
Thank you for that, Captain, it was the best seat in the house.
So, what do you think? Feeling refreshed and happy? Any new ideas?
So much pressure, Captain. You know, you should really be thankful I'm on your team.

Fields.MenuText: Don't be coy, what is it? I'm excited to turn things around out there.
Yes yes, we're very lucky, now tell me your idea.
It's about time you proved your worth. We put a lot of effort into making sure this went off without a hitch.

Fields.DialogueText: A lady never tells, Captain. I'll write it up for the fleet to review, but for now, suffice it to say it might be our turn to play the witch.
Not just yet, Captain, I need to write it up so the fleet can be prepared for the battle to come.
Don't be a git, Captain. I don't have anything to prove. This will just review my worth.
Very well, get those plans put together, and we'll put them to the test as soon as we can.
Not that I think the Morganas will keep us waiting.
@BATTLE
Are you sure about this, Nellie?  Using yourself as bait is a pretty dangerous.
I know, Captain. But I have more firepower than they're ready for. And I have plenty of frustrations to work off.
You don't think they'll be suspicious that we went back to your tactics? If they don't go for it this time...
I know the risks, Captain. This will work, and it's worth the gamble. They've been hurting us too much.
I know, and they must think we're getting desperate.
Captain, it's time we rammed a poisoned apple down the BF's throats. Just be ready to come in and support me when I pin them down.

Fields.MenuText: You know you don't have to do this. You don't have to prove anything to anyone.
I'm with you, Nellie. If this works, we'll break these monsters here, or at least give them a fight they won't soon forget.
Don't worry, Nellie. We'll have your back.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't have to do anything, but the only thing necessary for evil to triumph, is for good men and women to do nothing.
Thanks, Captain. I'm glad you're with me. Together, we can do this, I know we can.
Hah, that's the ticket Captain! I always feel safe as houses when I know you're behind me in a fight.
I'm glad to hear it, Nellie. Now, go feed the Morganas that poison apple, Lady Witch.
And you get your axe ready, Huntsman. Together, we'll rip these monsters' hearts out, and put them to sleep forever.
@BATTLE
I still can't believe your plan worked, Nelson.
Cor, I knew I was right! The BF can't stand against the righteousness of our cause and the thunder of our guns!
Hah. It feels good to be on the attack again. I'm glad you stuck with it.
Well, I did it - at least partially - because I believe in you. I knew you wouldn't have pushed me if you didn't think I could do it.
That's a lot of faith you have in me, Nellie. I'm glad we proved neither of us misplaced our trust, after all.
No barney there. I always knew you were a stand up sort.
That's what we have to be against those monsters.
Of course, this is just the beginning. We're going to need to keep coming up with new counters, because they are going to keep trying to break us.
Inspiration comes wherever it strikes. We just have to bodge a tactic together and bash on regardless until we catch it.

Fields.MenuText: I can't think of a better comrade in arms to stand by my side as we bring the Morganas to their knees.
Nellie, you inspire me. And by your leave, I would like to follow my muse to the end of the ocean.
